text: Robert Sylvester Graetz Jr. (May 16, 1928 â€“ September 20, 2020) was an American Lutheran clergyman. He was the white pastor of a black congregation in Montgomery, Alabama. He openly supported the Montgomery bus boycott and became a well known activist during the civil rights movement. Graetz died from Parkinson's disease at his home in Montgomery, Alabama on September 20, 2020 at the age of 92. ==References== Category:1928 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American civil rights activists Category:Writers from West Virginia Category:Writers from Montgomery, Alabama Category:American Lutherans Category:Religious people Category:Deaths from Parkinson's disease Category:Disease-related deaths in Alabama
title: Robert Graetz
